item.title: Limits of European strategic autonomy
item.description: EUROPE is entering a moment of renewed strategic doubt. Conversations about security that once seemed theoretical have taken on a sharper edge as uncertainty grows about America’s long-term role, the direction of the war in Ukraine, and the resilience of Europe’s own defense capabilities. Leaders say that they recognize the need for greater self-reliance, yet their.....

item.title: When blind forces guide nation
item.description: ONCE, a snake had two heads — one positioned normally, capable of seeing, and another at the end of its tail, which was unable to see. These two heads were in constant conflict, each claiming to be the real one. According to tradition, the snake moved forward under the guidance of the sighted head. One day, the blind head grabbed a stick and forced the snake to......

item.title: Urban household energy poverty
item.description: URBAN energy poverty refers to the inability of urban households to access affordable, reliable and clean energy services. This forces reliance on inefficient fuels, leading to high costs, health risks, reduced productivity, social exclusion and limited well-being in dense cities characterised by inequality, informal settlements, weak governance and ongoing infrastructure deficits......

item.title: Exploring halal economy
item.description: THE global halal economy has quietly transformed from a faith-based concept into a mainstream development opportunity. Once understood narrowly as a religious requirement related to food, halal today represents a broader system of ethical production, quality assurance, safety and transparency. It now spans food and beverage, pharmaceuticals, cosmetics, logistics......

item.title: Grave risks to children demand political action
item.description: A FRESH assessment of child rights presents an alarming picture of how unsafe childhood has become. The study, State of Child Rights 2025, draws on an analysis of reports published in national and local newspapers and finds a persistent and severe pattern of violence against children. Of the 1,867 news reports examined, 1,170, or 62.66 per cent, involved incidents of child......
